Cherrycake\Modules\DatabaseProvider::executeCache

executeCache

Executes a prepared query with Cache capabilities. If the prepared query results are stored in the cache, it retrieves it. If not in cache, it normally executes the prepared query and stores the results in cache. Stores results in cache in the form of a tridimensional arrays, storing the DatabaseResult->data variable.

    Signature

    public function executeCache(array $prepareResult, array $parameters, [boolean $cacheTtl = false, [boolean $cacheKeyNamingOptions = false, [boolean $overrideCacheProviderName = false, [boolean $isStoreInCacheWhenNoResults = true, [boolean $setup = false]]]]] )

    Parameters

    $prepareResult — array
    The prepared result as returned by the prepare method
    $parameters — array
    Hash array of the variables that must be applied to the prepared query in order to execute the final query, in the same order as are stated on the prepared sql. Same syntax as in execute method
    $cacheTtl — boolean
    The TTL for the cache results. If not specified, configuration value cacheDefaultTtl is used
    $cacheKeyNamingOptions — boolean
    If specified, takes the configuration keys as specified in \Cherrycake\Modules\Cache::buildCacheKey
    $overrideCacheProviderName — boolean
    The name of the alternative cache provider to use for this query. If specified, it will use this cache provider (as configured in cache.config.php) instead of the one configured in database.config.php
    $isStoreInCacheWhenNoResults — boolean
    Whether to store results in the cache when the query returned no rows or not
    $setup — boolean
    Optional array with additional options, See DatabaseResult::init for available options

    Returns

    DatabaseResult
    A provider-specific DatabaseResult class if the query has been executed or retrieved from the cache correctly, false otherwise.
